caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. External anatomy of
Anthopleura dowii Verrill, 1869
. A–D) Oral view of living specimen. E) Detail of acrorhagi. F) Detail of tentacles. Acrorhagi (Ac), Oral disc (Od), Verrucae (Ve).

FIGURE 4. Internal anatomy of
Anthopleura dowii Verrill, 1869
. A) Longitudinal section of the distal column showing marginal sphincter muscle and column specializations. B) Cross section of the column at the level of the actinopharynx showing the cycles of mesenteries (cycles marked by numbers). C) Cross section of column showing gametogenic tissue. D) Longitudinal section of proximal end showing basilar muscles. E) Detail of a cross section of the gametogenic tissue. F) Detail of a cross section of the column at the level of the actinopharynx showing the retractor and parietobasilar muscles. Acrorhagi (Ac), Basilar muscles (Ba), Fosse (Fo), Marginal projections (Mp), Parietobasilar muscles (Pa), Peduncle (Pe), Retractor muscles (Re). Siphonoglyphs (arrow). Spermatic cyst (Sc), Sphincter (Sp), Tentacle (Te), Verrucae (Ve). Scale bars: A, C–F, 0.1 mm; B, 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 5. Cnidae of
Anthopleura dowii Verrill, 1869
. A, B, D, E, H, I, K, L, N, O) Basitrichs. F, G, J) Holotrichs. P, Q) b - mastigophores. M) p -mastigophore A. R) p -mastigophore B1. C) Spirocyst.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Current list of sea anemones reported from the Mexican Pacific. Abbreviations: BC= Baja California; BCS, Baja California Sur; MPOBC= Mexican Pacific Coast other than Baja California; (?)= dubious record, not considered; *= records from the present study; ND= No data. (1) The record of
Phymactis clematis
by Carlgren (1951) was synonymized by Häusserman (2004) as
Phymactis papillosa .
(2) The record of
Hadalanthus
aff. knudseni by López-González et al . (2003) was synonymized by Sanamyan & Sanamyan (2007) as
Seepactis galkini
; these two records are listed here under the valid species.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 2. Taxa included in this study, with collection number, locality, coordinates, depth and date of collection. AMNH, American Museum of Natural History; m, meters; #, locality number corresponding with Fig. 1; *, species observed in a locality but not collected.

TABLE 3. Size ranges and distribution of cnidae of
Anthopleura dowii Verrill, 1869
. N, Total number of capsules measured; M, Ratio of number of specimens in which each cnidae was found to number of specimens examined. Sizes in micrometers. Letters in parenthesis correspond with images in Fig. 5. (1) , Category named as microbasic b -mastigophore by Daly (2004). (2) , Category named as microbasic p -mastigophore by Hand (1955).
